bibl.title: Versus anacyclici: The Case of P. Sorb. 72v (= adesp. com. fr. 52 PCG).
bibl.note: Suggests the piece may in fact be a school riddle, with the play's title as its solution.

bibl.title: The Muse at Play. Riddles and Wordplay in Greek and Latin Poetry

bibl.seg: Krystyna Bartol, Versus anacyclici: The Case of P. Sorb. 72v (= adesp. com. fr. 52 PCG).
Jan Kwapisz, David Petrain & Mikołaj Szymański (edd.), The Muse at Play. Riddles and Wordplay in Greek and Latin Poetry = Beiträge zur Altertumskunde. 305 (Berlin - Boston, 2013) pp. 309-319.
Suggests the piece may in fact be a school riddle, with the play's title as its solution.
